{{cpp/experimental/ranges/title|Movable}}
{{cpp/experimental/ranges/concepts/navbar}}
{{ddcl|header=experimental/ranges/concepts|since=ranges|1=
template&lt; class T &gt;
concept bool Movable =
    std::is_object&lt;T&gt;::value &amp;&amp;
    MoveConstructible&lt;T&gt; &amp;&amp;
    Assignable&lt;T&amp;, T&gt; &amp;&amp;
    Swappable&lt;T&gt;;
}}

The concept {{tt|Movable&lt;T&gt;}} specifies that {{tt|T}} is an object type that can moved (that is, it can be move constructed, move assigned, and lvalues of type {{tt|T}} can be swapped).

There need not be any subsumption relationship between {{tt|Movable&lt;T&gt;}} and {{c|std::is_object&lt;T&gt;::value}}.
